name: Mercury
planetFunFact: Mercury has the most extreme temperature fluctuations in the Solar System, ranging from -173°C at night to 427°C during the day.

name: Venus
planetFunFact: Venus rotates on its axis in the opposite direction to most planets, meaning the Sun rises in the west and sets in the east.

name: Earth
planetFunFact: Earth is the only planet in our Solar System known to support life and has the most liquid water.

name: Mars
planetFunFact: Mars is home to Olympus Mons, the tallest volcano and largest mountain in the Solar System.

name: Jupiter
planetFunFact: Jupiter has the Great Red Spot, a gigantic storm larger than Earth that has been raging for hundreds of years.

name: Saturn
planetFunFact: Saturn's rings are made up of billions of ice and rock particles, and are the most extensive ring system of any planet.

name: Uranus
planetFunFact: Uranus is unique for its sideways rotation, essentially orbiting the Sun on its side.

name: Neptune
planetFunFact: Neptune has the fastest winds in the Solar System, reaching speeds of up to 2,100 kilometers per hour.
